content.description: This climb has a large roof bypassed by easier holds on the left.  Mostly hands to a large ledge above a hanging block on the right.  Finishes on right @ 30' from the top.
content.location: Walk to the end of Main Wall and continue 25 yds down to the south-facing wall.  Look for hands to a roof.

content.description: The top half of the route climbs a right-facing dihedral with double roofs, crux moves passing the roofs.
content.protection: standard rack (singles) and rap is located on the north side of buttress just below the top.
content.location: Walk south on main wall's ledge trail to the last buttress, stop at the last of the east facing rock.  Above are two crack systems, this is the right most.  Climb easy juggy face with sparse pro to ledge and the business begins up the dihedral.

content.description: Climb the left crack through a small roof.  Be careful of loose rock on the top-out.
content.protection: Cams through #4 Camalot, plus nuts & runners.  Doubles of #1-4 Camalots would be nice.
content.location: Walk past the Main Wall and go around the corner to Oz Buttress.  Climb is located just left of Scarecrow.

climbs.name: Lazy Lion
climbs.fa: M. Rangel, E. Rangel, S. Tweito

content.description: The first pitch is easier on the right at the crux but I like to head up the center.  Second pitch requires pulling through sidepulls to a good hold putting you a ways past the bolt. Solid rock makes it easier to commit.
content.location: Found just left of Hail Dorothy's large chimney.  The start is a bit overhung on great big holds. Rap the route w/60m

content.description: The crux is getting on then past the tip of the triangular roof.  It's a longish sport route and mostly 10 except for the crux.  Clipping the third bolt is tricky but easier if you look for good holds on right and reach to clip.
content.protection: 11 bolts, slings for the bolted anchor if TRing the route.  Walk left and behind the block to the oak tree, the rap anchor is behind it.
content.location: Located just around the corner, the first bolted route facing south, just 30 yds from the main wall.

content.description: Last east-facing buttress on the main wall; wraps around to the south with more south-facing rock.
